name: hazard
trans: something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems
to risk losing your money, property etc in an attempt to gain something

name: justify
trans: to be a good and acceptable reason for something

name: voluntary
trans: done willingly and without being forced

name: connection
trans: the way in which two facts, ideas, events etc are related to each other, and one is affected or caused by the other

name: proof
trans: facts, information, documents etc that prove something is true

name: timber
trans: wood used for building or making things

name: roar
trans: to make a deep, very loud noise
a deep, loud noise made by an animal such as a lion, or by someone’s voice

name: presence
trans: when someone or something is present in a particular place

name: phase
trans: one of the stages of a process of development or change

name: surrounding
trans: near or around a particular place

name: efficiency
trans: the quality of doing something well and effectively, without wasting time, money, or energy

name: overhead
trans: above your head or in the sky
You use overhead to indicate that something is above you or above the place that you are talking about
money spent regularly on rent, insurance, electricity, and other things that are needed to keep a business operating

name: contract
trans: to sign a contract in which you agree formally that you will do something or someone will do something for you
an official agreement between two or more people, stating what each will do

name: conclude
trans: to decide that something is true after considering all the information you have

name: comprehension
trans: the ability to understand something

name: beggar
trans: someone who lives by asking people for food and money
to make someone very poor

name: leather
trans: animal skin that has been treated to preserve it, and is used for making shoes, bags etc

name: comb
trans: a flat piece of plastic, metal etc with a row of thin teeth on one side, used for making your hair tidy
to make hair look tidy using a comb

name: innovative
trans: an innovative idea or way of doing something is new, different, and better than those that existed before

name: insight
trans: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

name: fabric
trans: cloth used for making clothes, curtains etc

name: revolutionary
trans: completely new and different, especially in a way that leads to great improvements
someone who joins in or supports a political or social revolution

name: following
trans: You use following to refer to something that you are about to mention
a group of people who support or admire someone

name: exact
trans: completely correct in every detail
to demand and get something from someone by using threats, force etc

name: indoor
trans: used or happening inside a building

name: force
trans: to make someone or something move in a particular direction or into a different position, especially through or using great strength
military action used as a way of achieving your aims

name: centigrade
trans: Centigrade is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 0 degrees and boils at 100 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °C.

name: sexual
trans: relating to the physical activity of sex

name: sympathetic
trans: caring and feeling sorry about someone’s problems

name: freight
trans: goods that are carried by ship, train, or aircraft, and the system of moving these goods
to send goods by air, sea, or train

name: range
trans: to move around in an area without aiming for a particular place
a number of people or things that are all different, but are all of the same general type

name: distribution
trans: the act of sharing things among a large group of people in a planned way

name: tyre
trans: a thick rubber ring that fits around the wheel of a car, bicycle etc

name: derive
trans: to get a chemical substance from another substance

name: capacity
trans: someone’s ability to do something

name: cope
trans: to succeed in dealing with a difficult problem or situation

name: overseas
trans: to or in a foreign country that is across the sea
coming from, existing in, or happening in a foreign country that is across the sea

name: impress
trans: to press something into a soft surface so that a mark or pattern appears on it

name: confess
trans: to admit, especially to the police, that you have done something wrong or illegal

name: leak
trans: if a container, pipe, roof etc leaks, or if it leaks gas, liquid etc, there is a small hole or crack in it that lets gas or liquid flow through
a small hole that lets liquid or gas flow into or out of something

name: ghost
trans: the spirit of a dead person that some people think they can feel or see in a place

name: feature
trans: a part of something that you notice because it seems important, interesting, or typical
When something such as a film or exhibition features a particular person or thing, they are an important part of it

name: lean
trans: to move or bend your body in a particular direction
thin in a healthy and attractive way

name: flat
trans: in a position in which the surface of something is against another surface without curving or sloping
smooth and level, without raised or hollow areas, and not sloping or curving
a place for people to live that consists of a set of rooms that are part of a larger building

name: recall
trans: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past

name: leap
trans: if your heart leaps, you feel a sudden surprise, happiness, or excitement
a big jump

name: waterproof
trans: not allowing water to enter

name: barber
trans: a man whose job is to cut men’s hair and sometimes to  shave  them

name: precise
trans: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct

name: sensible
trans: reasonable, practical, and showing good judgment

name: objection
trans: a reason that you have for opposing or disapproving of something, or something you say that expresses this

name: dispute
trans: to say that something such as a fact or idea is not correct or true
a serious argument or disagreement

name: precious
trans: something that is precious is valuable and important and should not be wasted or used without care

name: observation
trans: the process of watching something or someone carefully for a period of time

name: tremble
trans: to shake slightly in a way that you cannot control, especially because you are upset or frightened
Tremble is also a noun

name: suspect
trans: not likely to be completely true
to think that something bad has happened or is happening
someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime

name: apologize
trans: to tell someone that you are sorry that you have done something wrong

name: inhabitant
trans: one of the people who live in a particular place

name: fraction
trans: a part of a whole number in mathematics, such as ½ or ¾

name: filter
trans: to remove unwanted substances from water, air etc by passing it through a special substance or piece of equipment
something that you pass water, air etc through in order to remove unwanted substances and make it clean or suitable to use

name: sunlight
trans: natural light that comes from the sun

name: site
trans: a place where something important or interesting happened
to place or build something in a particular place

name: emotion
trans: a strong human feeling such as love, hate, or anger

name: massive
trans: very large, solid, and heavy

name: cease
trans: to stop doing something or stop happening

name: assess
trans: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it

name: asset
trans: the things that a company owns, that can be sold to pay debts

name: owe
trans: to be successful because of the good effect or influence of something or someone

name: scarce
trans: if something is scarce, there is not very much of it available

name: minimum
trans: the minimum number, degree, or amount of something is the smallest or least that is possible, allowed, or needed
the smallest amount of something or number of things that is possible or necessary

name: queue
trans: to form or join a line of people or vehicles waiting to do something or go somewhere
a line of people waiting to enter a building, buy something etc, or a line of vehicles waiting to move

name: mathematical
trans: relating to or using mathematics

name: apology
trans: something that you say or write to show that you are sorry for doing something wrong

name: magic
trans: in stories, a magic word or object has special powers that make the person using it able to do impossible things
the power to make impossible things happen by saying special words or doing special actions

name: argument
trans: a situation in which two or more people disagree, often angrily

name: reveal
trans: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

name: data
trans: information or facts

name: theoretical
trans: relating to the study of ideas, especially scientific ideas, rather than with practical uses of the ideas or practical experience

name: adequate
trans: enough in quantity or of a good enough quality for a particular purpose

name: utter
trans: complete – used especially to emphasize that something is very bad, or that a feeling is very strong
to say something

name: onion
trans: a round white vegetable with a brown, red, or white skin and many layers. Onions have a strong taste and smell.

name: vibrate
trans: if something vibrates, or if you vibrate it, it shakes quickly and continuously with very small movements

name: drum
trans: to make a sound similar to a drum by hitting a surface again and again
a musical instrument made of skin stretched over a circular frame, played by hitting it with your hand or a stick

name: sausage
trans: a small tube of skin filled with a mixture of meat, spices etc, eaten hot or cold after it has been cooked

name: hopeful
trans: believing that what you hope for is likely to happen

name: tremendous
trans: very big, fast, powerful etc

name: condense
trans: if a gas condenses, or is condensed, it becomes a liquid

name: barrier
trans: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do

name: realistic
trans: judging and dealing with situations in a practical way according to what is actually possible rather than what you would like to happen

name: justice
trans: the quality of being right and deserving fair treatment

name: create
trans: to make something exist that did not exist before

name: criminal
trans: relating to crime
someone who is involved in illegal activities or has been proved guilty of a crime

name: tag
trans: a small piece of paper, plastic etc attached to something to show what it is, who owns it, what it costs etc
to attach a tag to something

name: notebook
trans: a book made of plain paper on which you can write notes

name: curious
trans: wanting to know about something

name: indirect
trans: not directly caused by something

name: individual
trans: considered separately from other people or things in the same group
a person, considered separately from the rest of the group or society that they live in

name: resource
trans: something such as useful land, or minerals such as oil or coal, that exists in a country and can be used to increase its wealth

name: ugly
trans: extremely unattractive and unpleasant to look at

name: nuisance
trans: a person, thing, or situation that annoys you or causes problems

name: tax
trans: an amount of money that you must pay to the government according to your income, property, goods etc and that is used to pay for public services
to charge a tax on something

name: earthquake
trans: a sudden shaking of the earth’s surface that often causes a lot of damage

name: excitement
trans: the feeling of being excited

name: nightmare
trans: a very frightening dream

name: cord
trans: a piece of thick string or thin rope

name: ending
trans: the way that a story, film, activity etc finishes

name: core
trans: the hard central part of a fruit such as an apple

name: council
trans: a group of people that are chosen to make rules, laws, or decisions, or to give advice

name: enforce
trans: to make people obey a rule or law

name: embassy
trans: a group of officials who represent their government in a foreign country, or the building they work in

name: departure
trans: an act of leaving a place, especially at the start of a journey

name: dash
trans: to go or run somewhere very quickly
to go or run somewhere very quickly
an occasion when someone runs somewhere very quickly in order to get away from something or someone, or in order to reach them

name: concrete
trans: definite and specific
a substance used for building that is made by mixing sand, small stones,  cement  , and water

name: penalty
trans: a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement

name: sociology
trans: the scientific study of societies and the behaviour of people in groups

name: link
trans: if two things are linked, they are related in some way
a way in which two things or ideas are related to each other

name: flee
trans: to leave somewhere very quickly, in order to escape from danger

name: distinct
trans: clearly different or belonging to a different type

name: scale
trans: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening
to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb

name: recovery
trans: the process of getting better after an illness, injury etc

name: hedge
trans: to avoid giving a direct answer to a question
a row of small bushes or trees growing close together, usually dividing one field or garden from another

name: tune
trans: a series of musical notes that are played or sung and are nice to listen to
to make a musical instrument play at the right  pitch

name: weep
trans: to cry, especially because you feel very sad

name: aware
trans: if you are aware that a situation exists, you realize or know that it exists

name: drama
trans: a play for the theatre, television, radio etc, usually a serious one, or plays in general

name: security
trans: protection from bad things that could happen to you

name: limp
trans: not firm or strong
to walk slowly and with difficulty because one leg is hurt or injured
the way someone walks when they are limping

name: award
trans: something such as a prize or money given to someone to reward them for something they have done
to officially give someone something such as a prize or money to reward them for something they have done

name: organize
trans: to manage a group of people who are doing something

name: marriage
trans: the relationship between two people who are married, or the state of being married

name: stove
trans: a thing used for heating a room or for cooking, which works by burning wood, coal, oil, or gas

name: alarm
trans: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger
to make someone feel worried or frightened

name: weed
trans: to remove unwanted plants from a garden or other place
a wild plant growing where it is not wanted that prevents crops or garden flowers from growing properly

name: continual
trans: continuing for a long time without stopping

name: herd
trans: a group of animals of one kind that live and feed together
to make animals move together in a group

name: limb
trans: an arm or leg

name: balloon
trans: an object made of brightly coloured thin rubber, that is filled with air and used as a toy or decoration for parties

name: motion
trans: If you motion to someone, you move your hand or head as a way of telling them to do something or telling them where to go
the process of moving or the way that someone or something moves

name: limited
trans: not very great in amount, number, ability etc

name: idle
trans: lazy
to spend time doing nothing

name: confidence
trans: the feeling that you can trust someone or something to be good, work well, or produce good results

name: arbitrary
trans: decided or arranged without any reason or plan, often unfairly

name: fearful
trans: frightened that something bad might happen

name: accent
trans: the way someone pronounces the words of a language, showing which country or which part of a country they come from

name: passive
trans: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

name: fertilizer
trans: a substance that is put on the soil to make plants grow

name: lorry
trans: a large vehicle for carrying heavy goods

name: carrier
trans: a company that moves goods or passengers from one place to another

name: fragment
trans: to break something, or be broken into a lot of small separate parts – used to show disapproval
a small piece of something that has broken off or that comes from something larger

name: corresponding
trans: caused by or connected with something you have already mentioned

name: response
trans: something that is done as a reaction to something that has happened or been said

name: treaty
trans: a formal written agreement between two or more countries or governments

name: responsive
trans: reacting quickly, in a positive way

name: ounce
trans: a unit for measuring weight, equal to 28.35 grams. There are 16 ounces in a pound.

name: challenge
trans: something that tests strength, skill, or ability, especially in a way that is interesting
to refuse to accept that something is right, fair, or legal

name: emit
trans: to send out gas, heat, light, sound etc

name: category
trans: a group of people or things that are all of the same type

name: rival
trans: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc
to be as good or important as someone or something else

name: intend
trans: If you intend to do something, you have decided or planned to do it

name: snap
trans: to break with a sudden sharp noise, or to make something do this
a judgment or decision made quickly, without careful thought or discussion
a sudden loud sound, especially made by something breaking or closing
